description: The Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) is the most well known Cisco certification path. It takes the general networking theory from the CCENT certification and applies it in real world scenarios. It moves beyond configuring individual devices into more complex territory often requiring the configuration of numerous devices to create a robust and optimized network. While studying for this certification, you will revisit the routing and switching topics from the CCENT in more depth as you learn about and implement the advanced features of each technology.
descriptionMD: The Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) is the most well known Cisco certification path. It takes the general networking theory from the CCENT certification and applies it in real world scenarios. It moves beyond configuring individual devices into more complex territory often requiring the configuration of numerous devices to create a robust and optimized network. While studying for this certification, you will revisit the routing and switching topics from the CCENT in more depth as you learn about and implement the advanced features of each technology.
name: CCNA Routing and Switching (2018)
subtitle: Cisco Certified Network Associate

episodes.description: The Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) is the most well known Cisco certification path. It takes the general networking theory from the CCENT certification and applies it in real world scenarios. It moves beyond configuring individual devices into more complex territory often requiring the configuration of numerous devices to create a robust and optimized network. While studying for this certification, you will revisit the routing and switching topics from the CCENT in more depth as you learn about and implement the advanced features of each technology.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review the vlan fundamentals and vlan configuration.  They show the requirements in configuring in the extended vlan requirement. Lastly, they show how to configure vlans in the lab environment.
episodes.title: Configure VLANs

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie continue with configuring vlans.  Previously, they defined vlans on a switch.  Here they assign ports to different vlans and verify their working.  They discuss the use of default vlans and best practice of moving ports to an unused vlan.
episodes.title: Configure VLANs Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review the concept of trunking. They review configuration issues and details.  These details inlcude setting the mode and the different modes possible.  They discuss details of configuring the mode differently on each end.
episodes.title: Configure Trunking

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie continue with the details of configuring trunking besides just functional configuration.  They show how to limit access to the trunk to only the configured vlans.  They discuss some of the details of VTP modes and vtp configuration revision and what can happened if  not sure of the configuration number.
episodes.title: Configure Trunking Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie continue with the lab by assigning interfaces to vlans after vtp configuration.  Verify the working of vtp and vlans. Lastly, they describe VTP pruning and it's use.
episodes.title: Configure Trunking Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie talk about the native vlan configuration. They demonstrate how to change this for trunking.  They also discuss issues that can happen with a native vlan mismatch between switches.
episodes.title: Configure Trunking Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie introduce STP, spanning-tree-protocol.  They begin with describing what each port does when it powers on and the port states it goes through.  The guys emphasize the issues with redundancy between switches and the results that happen:  broadcast storms, mac address table instabiity nad duplication of frames.  Lastly, they discuss the purpose of STP protocol and mention the end result of what it does.
episodes.title: Understand and Configure STP

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie explain the STP process.  They describe how the election of root bridge works.  The guys also explain the use of Hello BPDUs and the BID in the election process.  Then they describe what is included in the Hello BPDU.
episodes.title: Understand and Configure STP Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie continue with the STP process.  The process moves now to the nonroot bridge to determine the root port, according to the guys.  This root port is one of the different spanning-tree roles, the team describes, along with designated ports and non designated ports.  They also discuss the different port states and show the result of the spanning tree protocol.
episodes.title: Understand and Configure STP Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie beging to show the result of spanning-tree protocol using the labs.  They demonstrate how identify the root bridge and the different show commands used to see more spanning-tree information.  They also show the use of PVST to set different root bridges for different vlans too.
episodes.title: Understand and Configure STP Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie continue with the lab to show the default STP mode that is set and how to change it.  They begin with a review of some of the concepts learned in the spanning-tree series and complete the basic STP configuration with demonstrating how to configure a switch to use 802.1w instead of PVST.
episodes.title: Understand and Configure STP Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe some of the layer 2 attacks that may need to be mitigated.  They show the application of 802.1x and DHCP snooping.  Lastly, they configure the nondefault native LAN.
episodes.title: Configure PortFast and BPDU guard

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie introduce link aggregation and etherchannel. The team discuss it's usage and result. Lastly, using the labs, they configure static Ethernet.
episodes.title: Configure Etherchannel

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie continue with another way to configure Etherchannel.  They describe PAgP and LACP and demonstrate it's configuration, paying attention to the terms. Using the show etherchannel summary command, they describe how to verify it has changed to PAgP and that it is operational unless both switches are set to auto or passive
episodes.title: Configure Etherchannel Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie configure a layer 3 etherchannel.  The demonstrate how to remove previous EtherChannel configuration.  They point out how is different from the layer 2 etherchannel
episodes.title: Configure Etherchannel Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe switch aggregation technologies: Switch Stacking and Chassis Aggregation.  They describe it's usages and application as well as the benefits to implementing them.
episodes.title: Describe Switch Aggregation Benefits

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe some of the layer 2 attacks that may need to be mitigated.  They show the application of 802.1x and DHCP snooping.  Lastly, they configure the nondefault native LAN.
episodes.title: Describe Switch Threat and Mitigation

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review the concepts of intervlan routing, specifically, "Router on a Stick. They talk about each component to be configured as well verifying the correct configuration necessary for it to work.
episodes.title: Configure InterVLAN Routing

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie reconfigure the intervlan routing to use a layer 3 switch.  They setup the SVIs with ip addresses and show how to verify it's proper working and configuration.
episodes.title: Configure InterVLAN Routing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie begin with an over of dynamic routing protcols and how they work on the router.  They emphasize terminology used with them.  The guys describe the two major categories of IP routing protocols.
episodes.title: Compare and Contrast IGPs

episodes.description: In this episode, they review the Distance Vector protocol function, algorithm metric and function.  They review routing loop problem that can be caused by DV protocols and the methods used to prevent them.
episodes.title: Compare and Contrast IGPs Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie continue with the comparison and constrast focusing now on link-state routing.  They describe the way that the link state builds it's database and the algoritm it uses to put routes into the routing table.
episodes.title: Compare and Contrast IGPs Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the basic OSPF operations.  The guys talke a look at the purpose of the neighbor adjacency and how they become neighbors step by step.
episodes.title: Configure Single Area OSPFv2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie continue with the basic operations focusing in on what is in a neighbor hello and the agreement that must occur for the neighbor adjacency.  They describe the DR, BDR and DROTHER and the DR election.  They discuss briefly the idea of ospf "cost" and area.
episodes.title: Configure Single Area OSPF Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie begin with describing the results of a single area ospf routing domain.  They also demonstrate how to configure it between 3 routers.  Using they lab, the guys configure multiple routers to show neighborships, and syslog messages as well the operation the protocol.
episodes.title: Configure Single Area OSPFv2 Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie continue with the lab configuration by adding in one more router into the ospf routing domain.  The team then verifies it's operation and output on the routers by examining not only the neighbor adjacency but running protocol and the routing table.  Lastly, they show how to manipulate ospf to not advertise out an interface using passive-interface commands and chance a router-id after it's operational.
episodes.title: Configure Single Area OSPFv2 Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss some of the other feature of OSPF.  They also describe the multiarea ospf differences from single-area.
episodes.title: Configure Multiarea OSPFv2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the idea of ospf authentication and begin with configuring Multiarea OSPFv2.  They demonsrate how to configure an ABR and internal router.  They discuss the idea of backbone areas.
episodes.title: Configure Multiarea OSPFv2 Part 2 ccna2018

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to configure passive-interfaces and changing the cost.  They discuss the need to configure cost on the routers the same.
episodes.title: Configure Multiarea OSPFv2 Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie introduce OSPFv3.  They describe the functionality as the the same as OSPFv2. The configuration is different that requires configuration at the ospfv3 router and per interface, according to the team.  They show how to configure it and verify taht it works
episodes.title: Configure Single-Area OSPFv3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie configure multiarea OSPFv3.  The guys show the configuration differences from OSPFv2.  They emphasize show commands and remind us to remember to check our commands are for IPv6 rather than IPv4.
episodes.title: Configure Multiarea OSPFv3 ccna2018

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie introduce EIGRP.  The team compares many of the concepts and operations to ospf and then discuss their differnces.  They describe how EIGRP works to put routes into the routing table.
episodes.title: Understand EIGRP Concepts and Operations

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie, continue with EIGRP details.  The guys discuss the metric weights and how EIGRP metric works.  They also demonstrate how to determine the metric using the EIGRP formula, providing examples.
episodes.title: Understand EIGRP Concepts and Operations Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie complete the concept and discussing EIGRP operations.  They discuss some of the concepts that make EIGRP more unique in its operation and sophisticated too.
episodes.title: Understand EIGRP Concepts and Operations Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie configure an EIGRP routing domain for AS 800.  They show how to configure 3 routers to use EIGRP to adverstise routes.  The verify that the routers are learning routes via EIGRP.
episodes.title: Configure EIGRP for IPv4 ccna2018

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie configure additional eigrp options to influence routing selection.  They use variance command, auto-summmary and even manipulate the bandwidth on interfaces to change what gets into the routing table for EIGRP.
episodes.title: Configure EIGRP for IPv4 Part 2

episodes.description: Configure EIGRP for IPv6
episodes.title: Configure EIGRP for IPv6

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the use of PPP over serial links.  They also show how to configure it for encapsulation PPP and ppp authentication.
episodes.title: Configure PPP and MLPPP

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie continue with ppp configuration but now adding in the element of loadbalancing by using multilink ppp configuration.  They demonstrate how each interface must be configured along with the multilink interface. Lastly, the team configures ppp authentication on the multilink.
episodes.title: Configure PPP and MLPPP Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie introduce the basic concept of using PPPoE.  Then, they show the configuration of both the server side configuration and the client side configuration.  Though the CCNA candidate is only responsible for the client side configuration, the team explains it's difficult to understand what is being configured on the one side without the other.
episodes.title: Configure Client-Side PPPoE

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the basic usage of the GRE tunnel. Using that as a base, they configure the GRE tunnel and verify that it works.
episodes.title: Configure GRE Tunnel Connectivity

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe what a WAN is and why we need them.  The guys also talk about some od the different types of WAN topologies that are configured by the service provider for the customer's need.
episodes.title: Describe WAN Topology Options

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the different WAN access methods.  The team describes MPLS, Metro Ethernet, PPPoE and Internet VPNs.  They cover basics in fucntionality and why customers might choose them.
episodes.title: Describe WAN Access Connectivity

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the basics of IGP vs EGP to setup for configuring single-homed eBGP.  They describe what it means as well as talk about the basics and show how to configure to advertise into remote BGP system.
episodes.title: Configure Single-homed Branch - eBGP IPv4

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe HSRP and why it is used.  Using the lab, they show the configuration and verify it's operation not only when everything is working but also when a router in the group fails.
episodes.title: Configure Basic HSRP

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss Cloud Resources.  They discuss how to access cloud resources and the different types of virtual services available. Lastly, they describe the virtual network infrastructure.
episodes.title: Describe Cloud Resource Impact on Enterprise

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie introduce the concepts of Basic QoS concepts.  Theys talk about how it works and define terminology that is used in QoS that the cisco professional should know for the exam.
episodes.title: Describe Basic QoS Concepts

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review the concepts of ACLs.  They discuss not only the types but also what they can be used for.  The guys describe the 2 step process: configuring ACLs correctly and placing it on the interface.  Lastly, they show how to configure and verify a standard ACL.
episodes.title: Configure Access-lists for Filtering

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie continue configuring ACLs for filtering.  They show how to configure and verify extended ACLs working.  Lastly, they show how to configure IPv6 access control lists too.
episodes.title: Configure Access-lists for Filtering Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the use of the APIC-EM Path Trace ACL tool. They show where to get access to the lab and how to configure it for use.  Lastly, the team demonstrates the steps:  discovery first, then path trace to show where to isolate the ACL.
episodes.title: Use APIC-EM Path Trace

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie begin by discussing what SNMP is and what is required to make it work.  The guys also talk about the different versions and the most common version is using SNMPv2c.  They configure snmp for version 2c and version 3.
episodes.title: Configure SNMP for Device Monitoring

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie take a look at Echo-based IP SLAs and why we use them.  Using the practice labs, they demonstrate the configuration and implementation of it.
episodes.title: Troubleshoot Connectivity with IP SLA

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the concept of SPAN or "port mirroring."  They discuss the reason to use it and some of the weaknesses it has.  The team then shows the simple configuration of local SPAN and verify it's operation by seeing the data from the monitored port.
episodes.title: Troubleshoot Problems with SPAN

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe using AAA for device management.  They explain the difference between TACACS+ and RADIUS.  They demonstrate the router configuration necessary to connect to the AAA server.
episodes.title: Describe Device Mgmt Using AAA

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe network programmability.  The guys begin by describing how networking devices function now with the control plane and data plan.  Next they discuss the use of the network controller and APIs used with SDNs
episodes.title: Describe Network Programmability

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review of the basic tools used to troubleshoot end-to-end connectivity.  The guys demonstrate the use of ping, extended ping and traceroute to demonstrate their purpose and use.
episodes.title: Troubleshoot End-to-End Connectivity
